hi,

just a sentence for relaxing, out of Robert Binders "Testing OO Softw=
are.."

It doesn't matter whether a cat is black or white
so long as it cat=
ches mice 
(Deng Xiaoping).

Betreff: [junit] Re: black box or white box?



> > Fo=
r example, for some index class, if you know it uses a linear 
list up
> > =
to 5 items and then a hash table, choosing to test with 4 items 
to test
> =
> the list case and also test with 5 items to test the hash table 
case is
=
> > white box testing.
> 
> Yes.  That is an example of whitebox testing.
>=

> [...]
>
> Different tools for different fools:
> 
> JUnit is designed fo=
r blackbox testing.  That is how it should be 
used.
> The new JDK 1.4 asse=
rtion facilities are for whitebox testing.  
That is
> how they should be u=
sed.

Can you please explain why it would be a bad idea to use JUnit in the=
 
above example and how assertions would be the more appropriate tool?

Tha=
nx, Ilja
